title: Effects of dietary citrus pulp on glucolipid metabolism of largemouth bass (Micropterus salmoides).
abstract: Citrus pulp (CP) is rich in pectin, which exhibits anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and hypolipidemic properties. Despite these advantages, the application of CP in aquafeed remains limited. This study investigated the effects of dietary CP inclusion on the glucolipid metabolism of largemouth bass (Micropterus salmoides).
journal: Journal of the science of food and agriculture
